images.caption: Figure 1:Schematic illustration of the pilot experiment. In this example, naively concatenating captions from the video and audio modalities fails to yield a correct answer to the corresponding question. In contrast, jointly processing both modalities to generate a time-aligned caption provides sufficient information, as indicated by the underlined text.

Figure 2:The pipeline for generating high-quality temporally-aligned audiovisual video captions. For clarity, corresponding audio-visual events before and after fusion are marked with circled numbers and underlined for reference.
Figure 3:Illustration of the three rewardsℛC\mathcal{R}_{C},ℛD\mathcal{R}_{D}, andℛL\mathcal{R}_{L}, which are specifically designed for improving the quality of audiovisual video captioning.
Figure 4:An illustration of a video caption generated by AVoCaDO, featuring bothprecise audiovisual temporal alignmentandaccurate dialogue rendering.
